title: Resolutions Passed at the Annual General Meeting of Ellah Lakes Plc
head_office_address: No. 12 Ihama Road, G.R.A, Benin City, Edo State
meeting_location: The Workstation, 7, Ibiyinka Olorunbe Close, Victoria Island, Lagos
agenda_items: That the Company’s audited financial statements for the year ended 31 July 2022 together with the reports of the Directors, Auditors and Audit Committee be and are hereby received and accepted.

That the re-election of Mrs. Hauwa Nuru, Ms. Nnenna Onyewuchi, Mr. Shehu Abubakar and Mr. Charles Anajemba who are retiring by rotation and have offered themselves up for re-election be and is hereby approved.
That Messrs. Olabode Akande & Co. be and are hereby appointed as the Auditor of the Company for the financial year ending 31 July 2023.
That the board of directors of the Company be and are hereby authorised to fix the remuneration of the Auditors.
The remuneration of the Managers of the Company was disclosed in line with Section 257 of the Companies & Allied Matters Act 2020.
That the following persons be and hereby nominated as the Directors to serve on the Statutory Audit Committee: Ms. Osaro Oyegun; and Ms. Nnenna Onyewuchi.

That the following persons be and are hereby elected as the shareholders’ representatives on the Statutory Audit Committee: Pastor Edokpayi Wilfred; Mr. Olugbosun Banji; and Mr. Ezechukwu Augustine Nnaemeka.
The Board of Directors be and are hereby authorised to raise capital of ₦2,900,000,000 or such other amount as they may determine by way of a Rights Issue of ordinary shares to its shareholders.

That the Board of Directors be and are hereby authorised to raise via private placement, or any other equity issuance, any shortfall pursuant to resolution (8) above, not raised from the Rights Issue.

That subject to complying with applicable regulatory requirements, the Board of Directors be authorised to apply any convertible loan, shareholder loan or any other moneys due to any person, from the Company, as may be agreed by the person and the Company, towards payment for any shares or rights subscribed for in the Rights Issue or Other Equity Issue.

That the Board of Directors be and are hereby authorised to approve, sign and/or execute all documents, appoint such professional parties and advisers, as may be necessary to give effect to the above resolutions.
That following allotment by the Board of Directors, the new shares issued by the Company pursuant to the Rights Issue and Other Equity Issue be listed on the Nigerian Stock Exchange.
That all acts carried out by the Board of Directors and/or management of the Company in connection with the above be and are hereby approved and ratified.

That the Board of Directors be and are hereby authorised to perform other acts, take other steps or do all such other things as may be necessary for or incidental to, or as they deem appropriate to giving effect to Rights Issue and Other Equity Issue.
That the share capital of the Company be and is hereby increased from ₦1,000,000,000 to ₦1,500,000,000 by the creation of 1,000,000,000 additional ordinary shares of 50 kobo each.
That pursuant to the increase in the Share Capital arising from the Rights Issue and the Other Equity Issue of the Company, the Memorandum of Association of the Company be and is hereby amended.

That the Object Clause of the Memorandum of Association of the Company be and is amended by deleting in its entirety, Clause 3(7) and replacing it with the following new Clause 3(7) of the Memorandum of Association of the Company.
That the Articles of Association of the Company be and is hereby amended.
That the Company be and is hereby authorised to enter into a related party transaction with CBO Capital Partners Limited for the conversion of its loan to equity.

That the employee equity incentive as proposed by the Board of Directors of the Company be and is hereby approved and to issue shares to qualifying employees, subject to the applicable regulatory approval.
detailed_summary:
# Summary of Corporate Disclosure Document for Ellah Lakes Plc

## Purpose and Nature of the Disclosure
This document serves as the official record of the resolutions passed during the Annual General Meeting (AGM) of Ellah Lakes Plc, held on December 1, 2022, at The Workstation, Victoria Island, Lagos. The document outlines the decisions made regarding the company's financial statements, director elections, auditor appointments, capital raising, and amendments to the company's Memorandum and Articles of Association.

## Key Dates
- **AGM Date:** December 1, 2022
- **Financial Year Ended:** July 31, 2022
- **Next Financial Year Ending:** July 31, 2023

## Directors Present
The following directors were mentioned in the document:
- Olu Akpata
- Chuka Mordi
- Shehu Abubakar
- Osaro Oyegun
- Evans Jakpa-Johns
- Maxwell Oko
- Nnenna Onyewuchi
- Enotie Ogbebor
- Chijioke Dozie
- Hauwa Nuru
- Joe Attueyi
- Charles Anajemba

## Resolutions Passed
1. **Acceptance of Financial Statements:** The audited financial statements for the year ended July 31, 2022, along with the reports of the Directors, Auditors, and Audit Committee, were received and accepted.
   
2. **Re-election of Directors:** The re-election of the following directors was approved:
   - Mrs. Hauwa Nuru
   - Ms. Nnenna Onyewuchi
   - Mr. Shehu Abubakar
   - Mr. Charles Anajemba

3. **Appointment of Auditors:** Messrs. Olabode Akande & Co. were appointed as the Auditor for the financial year ending July 31, 2023.

4. **Auditor Remuneration:** The Board of Directors was authorized to fix the remuneration of the Auditors.

5. **Disclosure of Managerial Remuneration:** The remuneration of the Managers was disclosed in accordance with Section 257 of the Companies & Allied Matters Act 2020.

6. **Statutory Audit Committee Nominations:**
   - Nominated Directors:
     - Ms. Osaro Oyegun
     - Ms. Nnenna Onyewuchi
   - Elected Shareholders’ Representatives:
     - Pastor Edokpayi Wilfred
     - Mr. Olugbosun Banji
     - Mr. Ezechukwu Augustine Nnaemeka

7. **Capital Raising Authorization:** The Board was authorized to raise ₦2,900,000,000 (two billion, nine hundred million Naira) through a Rights Issue of ordinary shares.

8. **Private Placement Authorization:** The Board was authorized to raise any shortfall from the Rights Issue through private placement or other equity issuance.

9. **Convertible Loans Application:** The Board was authorized to apply any convertible loan or shareholder loan towards payment for shares in the Rights Issue or Other Equity Issue.

10. **Document Execution Authorization:** The Board was authorized to approve, sign, and execute all necessary documents to effect the above resolutions.

11. **Listing of New Shares:** New shares issued pursuant to the Rights Issue and Other Equity Issue are to be listed on the Nigerian Stock Exchange.

12. **Ratification of Board Actions:** All acts carried out by the Board in connection with the above resolutions were approved and ratified.

13. **Share Capital Increase:** The share capital was increased from ₦1,000,000,000 to ₦1,500,000,000 by creating 1,000,000,000 additional ordinary shares of 50 kobo each.

14. **Amendment of Memorandum of Association:** The Memorandum of Association was amended to reflect the new share capital and the new object clause related to horticulture and seed production.

15. **Amendment of Articles of Association:** Various articles were amended to align with the Companies and Allied Matters Act 2020, including provisions for share issuance and alterations of share capital.

16. **Related Party Transaction Authorization:** The company was authorized to enter into a related party transaction with CBO Capital Partners Limited for the conversion of its loan to equity.

17. **Employee Equity Incentive Approval:** The employee equity incentive plan proposed by the Board was approved, allowing shares to be issued to qualifying employees, subject to regulatory approval.

## Regulatory Requirements and Compliance
The document indicates compliance with the Companies and Allied Matters Act 2020 and the Nigerian Stock Exchange’s Rules Governing Transactions with Related Parties or Interested Persons.

## Conclusion
The resolutions passed during the AGM reflect significant corporate governance actions, including financial approvals, director elections, capital raising strategies, and amendments to the company's governing documents, all aimed at enhancing the operational capacity and compliance of Ellah Lakes Plc. 

**Signed:**
OAKE Legal (Company Secretary)
